page.title: 14TRANSPORT NEAR WEST WRATTING
page.content: {Public:-}The nearest railway stations are at Cambridge (12 miles) and Dullingham (8 miles). The buses are the only kind available in the area and run as folllows: Several daily services into Cambridge Monday to Saturday; a twice weekly service into Haverhill, the Friday (market day) one introduced only this year due to the initiative of a West Wickham housewife; one weekly service to Newmarket also on market day. Unfortunately there are no buses on Sundays or after 6pm. Free school buses are provided. One daily each for the primary school children to Balsham and secondary school children to Linton. {Private:-}Nearly every household has a car or has access to one. This is supplemented by locally run taxi services.
